intro: Geonoma undata subsp. edulis, commonly known as the edible fern, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its short, upright rhizome and clustered, lance-shaped leaves that form a rosette. Its inflorescence consists of small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color. The plant is notable for its edible young shoots and leaves, which are used in local cuisines.
